strings.command.help.sub.title: Help page for {1}{2}

subcommands.help: Lists all commands you have permissions to use.
Lists every command, even the ones, you don't have permissions to use.
Lists the help page for a particular command.
Write a welcome message into the chat.
Welcomes a user with a random welcoming message.
Writes a random number from 1 to 6.
Writes a random number from <minimum> to <maximum>.
You can roll up to 10 dice. Use the dice syntax <COUNT>d<FACES>+/-<MALUS>.
Rolls two 20-faced dice and adds 2 to the result (but 20 is max). After that KIRA rolls a 6-faced dice.
Writes a random joke.
Gibt Informationen zu dem Nutzer aus.
Alle Akteneintr√§ge des Nutzers anzeigen.
Den Eintrag mit der ID <entry> des Nutzers <user> anzeigen.

command.help.command.activate.std: Activates a command on the server.

subcommands.help: Activates the command <command> on the server.

command.help.command.deactivate.std: Deactivates a command on the server.

subcommands.help: Deactivates the command <command> on the server.

command.help.command.alias.std: Creates an alias for a command.

subcommands.help: Creates an alias with the name <alias> for the command <command>.
Shows all aliases for the command <command>.
Shows, which command the alias <alias> belongs to.
Bans a user <user> with the message <why> and adds it to his user file. <why> will be send to him by KIRA automatically.
Unbans the user <user>.
Creates a new RSS feed from the RSS URL <feedURL> in the channel with the ID <channelID>.
Changes the color of the RSS feed with the ID <feedID> to the color <color>. The color has to be a hex-color.
Sets the feed title of the RSS feed with ID <feedID> to <title>.
Removes the RSS feed with the ID <feedID>.
Lists all RSS feeds.
Lists all RSS feeds for the channel with the ID <channelID>.
Lists all languages an their IDs.
Changes the language of KIRA to the language with the ID <languageID>.
Changes the server side translation with the key <key> to the value <value>.
Removes the server side translation with the key <key>.
Deletes all data of the user <user>.
Sets the log channel to <channelID>. KIRA will log new users, ban/unbans, kicks, saves and more.
Shows the role that's used for !mute.
Sets the role to <roleID> that's used for !mute.
Kicks a user <user> with the message <why> and adds it to his user file. <why> will be send to him by KIRA automatically.

command.help.command.perm.std: Changes the permissions of users or roles.

subcommands.help: Every command has it's own permission. Users need to have an enabled permission in order to be able of using a command.
The permission `a.*` is equal to `a.b.c.d`. Therefore strings ending with a asterisk is equal to every permission starting with this string.

Permission a user has is superior to the ones of his roles, also disabled permissions disable enabled permissions. This is combinable with asterisk (for example: enabling `command.*` and disabling `command.joke`).
Lists all permissions.
Gives the user <user> the permission <permission>.
Disables the permission <permission> for the user <user>.
Removes the permission <permission> from the user <user>. (The permission will be removed from their enabled/disabled permissions lists.)
Shows all enabled and disabled permissions of user <user>.
Activates the permission <permission> for the role with the ID <roleID>.
Deactivates the permission <permission> for the role with the ID <roleID>.
Removes the permission <permission> from the role <roleID>. (The permission will be removed from its enabled/disabled permissions lists.)
Shows all enabled/disabled permissions for the role with the ID <roleID>.
Relaods the server's settings.
Installs a KIRA Patch from <URL>.
The server's settings will be saved.
Writes <message> in the channel <channel>.

command.help.command.report.std: Adds an entry to a user's file.

subcommands.help: Adds an entry with <message> to <user>'s user file.
Removes the entry with the ID <entryID> from <user>'s user file.
Thank KIRA.
KIRA will thank <user>.
Pong!
Stop KIRA.
Removes the alias <alias>.
Reload all servers and translations.
Shows a help for KIRAs syntax.
Refreshes KIRAs user list.

command.help.command.get_log.std: Sends you the logs of the bot via a direct message.

subcommands.help: Sends you the log from the date <date>. Notice the date format DD.MM.YYYY!
Sends you the last 3 logs.
Sends you the current log.
Deletes a auto-response message. Please note: Use quotation marks around <key> to help KIRA get it correctly.
Deletes a auto-response message.
Lists all auto-responses.
The message <key> is automatically answered by KIRA with <response>. Please note: Use quotation marks around <key> and <respond> to help KIRA get it correctly.
The message <key> is automatically answered by KIRA with <response>.

command.help.command.stat.std: Searches for users in the member-list of the server.

subcommands.help: Picks all users, who fulfill certain queries. A user has to fulfill all queries to be listed. Multiple queries can be connected by "or".
The last message of a user has to be in a specific lapse of time: <time>.
The user has to have more (>), less (<) or equal (:) messages compared to <count>. See the example at the end.
The user has the permission <permission>.
The user has a role with the ID <id>. Only IDs are allowed.
The user is a member since <time>.
To define a space of time, you use numbers with one of the suffixes d (day), w (weel), m (month) or y (year). 1y2m means 1 year and 2 months. 3d5m means 3 days and 5 months. Spaces are not allowed.
Lists all users, who either did join or write a message in the last month or all users who did write less than 10 messages.
Creates a name for a shipping of two characters. For Names with spaces see `!help syntax`.

command.help.command.info.std: Lists general information about the currently running KIRA instance.

subcommands.help: Lists general information about the currently running KIRA instance.

command.help.command.search.std: Uses the Crom-API to search for different entries and authors on all branches.

subcommands.help: Searches for authors and pages similar to <query>.
Searches on all branches for articles with titles about SCP-001.
Searches on the german branch for articles with titles about SCP-001.
Searches on the german, the original english and on the portugese branch for articles with titles about SCP-017.

strings.command.help.syntax:
In help pages, everything in `<` and `>` is a necessary variable. Everything in `[` and `]` are optional. For example:
```!help [command]```
[command] doesn't have to be given.

Every not quoted string will be splitted at whitespaces. For example:
```!hello world wow```
`hello` is the command, `world` and `wow` are arguments. If you want to have `Hello World!` as one argument, you have to add quotation marks. For example: ```!a "Hello World!"```
command.help.ywc: I will ignore the fact, that I don't have feelings and that your gratefulness can't touch me. So: You're welcome!
